en: This is a PNGTubing App made to be as lightweight and easy to use as possible. This app is based off PNGTuber+. Main goal is to implement new features as fix bugs from the original software and improve existing ones.
Only works if your mouth shapes are in a sprite-sheet. 14 frames\n(Check the Lipsync configuration)
Animates SpriteSheet depending on mouse position (Horizontally and Vertically)
Sets any animation type (APNG, GIF or SpriteSheet) to only play once.

Okay, so bear with me!, You might have noticed many sliders here use Amp and Freq. If you don't know how they work, here is a very basic explanation! Amplitude is the main value, how high or low the object would reach, Frequency is how fast the Amp takes to go from + to - through given time.

Held Sprite Inputs :
- Moving Sprite : Click and drag around.
- Move Origin : Arrow Keys or by holding Ctrl on your keyboard and pressing where you want the origin to be.
- Scroll mouse wheel on sliders for more accurate results.

Input Remap :
- Click the button of the state you want.

to remap and then add the new button:
- Change States with input : Captures Input
when minimized if on.

Control Bounce :
- Click on bounce top bar to change the bounce and gravity to your desire.

Mouse Controls :
- Scroll Wheel to zoom in/ out.
- Middle Mouse button to pan the camera.
An Accessibility feature aimed at helping users and viewers with Color-blindness with viewing the Model.
An Accessibility feature aimed at helping users and viewers with Color-blindness with viewing the Model.
Making the software able to change States and other toggles using Hotkeys.
Shows the Asset only and doesn't hide it even when key is pressed again.

Who made this software?
- TheMime (me) is the current main dev, buuut community help is still open and appreciated!

Is this really PNGTubing or Vtubing or ???
- This form of PNGTubing is the closest thing to Vtubing. Consider it a middle point I guess, lol. Still not as complex as real Vtuber models, so I personally thing it is PNGTubing still!

Why is some of the code a bit of a mess?
- When I first made this software, I barely knew much about coding, I won't lie when I tell you some code is embarrassing and I hope to improve it myself or with community help. You can find the source code's link in the credits!

You mentioned ToonTubing in the the What is PNGTubing?" tab. Will this ever get supported?
- Maybe
es:
I am currently working on a personal (private) demo to add a form of easy to understand visual scripting system to be able to pull this sort of stuff. Wish me luck lol!

How can I support this project?
- You can simply share it around (but please don't be annoying) and show off your model made in it. Adding credit at some point to the software would be nice!

An Asset is a Sprite you can toggle at any time. I.e glasses, hats, etc..

Animate to Mouse must be turned on in order for this feature to work when toggled off, it stops the sprite from moving on the x and y axis, but keeps the Animate to Mouse working.

Auto Rotates your Sprite. The speed can be changed from the Rot-Speed.

* Mouse Controls
- Rotation : Ctrl+MouseWheel (Up, Down)
- Camera Zoom : MouseWheel (Up, Down)
- Camera Drag : MouseWheel (Pressed)

*Keyboard Controls 
- Moving Sprite : 
> Ctrl+W (Up)
> Ctrl+S (Down)
> Ctrl+A (Left)
> Ctrl+D (Right)

- Moving Offset : 
> Arrow-Up (Up)
> Arrow-Down (Down)
> Arrow-Left (Left)
> Arrow-Right (Right)

- Quick Save : Ctrl+S
- Quick Deselect : Alt+D
- Quick Window Centering : Ctrl+ Kp -

Keys that makes your Sprite Disappear whenever toggled.
List of Keys (Must correspond to another asset's Key) that makes The selected Asset disappear.
Make sure to save your Model first before switching modes since this takes you to a completely separate session of the software.
Which Session type do you want to switch to?
Auto Rotates your Sprite. The speed can be changed from the Rot-Speed.

The movement Ticks uses (Tick + 1 every frame),
which could lead to very strong movements even with low
movement values.
Using DeltaTime makes it slower ( Tick + 0.016 every frame)
and more forgiving to use higher values.
This needs to be set for every model to prevent sharing issues.

PNGTubing is a form of Vtubing. However, unlike Vtubing, it is much simpler and less costly. This is why it gained popularity in recent years. There are some different types of PNGTubing, this includes Static (like the model shown), Toon and Rigged. In this software -PNGTube-Remix, you can create both Static and Rigged! Even mix them up if needed. Hope you have fun!
Syncs the wiggle effect of the Sprite with the Parent's Wiggle effect (Both must be Sprite Objects)
